content.description: Hard boulder start leads to big ledge. Get a rest here though not as good as it looks then fire the 2nd crux. Climbing above is easier but not done until the anchors. Great route!! May need a stick clip for first bolt unless you are solid at this grade.
content.location: The arete on the west end of crag central or to the left of French Connection

content.description: This is the first route to the right of Cruise Control. Devious sustained climbing up a blank face leads to slight runout up top. Use of a small cam is useful when you traverse the top section. 2 options are available for top out. 1- move left to the cedar tree above Cruise Control and anchor there or 2- move right to gain the anchors of Scarlets Begonias.
content.location: 1st climb to the right of Cruise Control

content.description:
This is a fun, sustained 5.10 face climb up a black streak. The climbing is slightly less than vertical, balancy, and techy. Follow four bolts, finding crimps and edges that lead to a ledge with a bolted anchor. 

  According to Cole Fennel's book, this was Arkansas' first sport route.
content.protection: 4 lead bolts and a bolted anchor on top. The bolts are somewhat runout compared to more modern sport routes. (Same anchor as Sonya Come Home.)
content.location: Bolted route to the right of Cruise Control and Sonya Come Home. Left of the obvious roof system on The Nose.

content.description: A mega classic for sure! As overhanging as this one is the climbing never gets as difficult as it looks. It is committing and scary on lead but it protects well and the holds are all there. Starts off climbing up easy terrain up to the roof. Plug in some cams or whatever and climb out on the diving board and go for the top. Very fun!! If you fall on the final head wall you will catch major air. - NOTE- It is hard to clean this route when the leader tops out and is best to anchor for the top and belay the second from there.
content.location: To the right of Cruise Control. This is one climb here you can't miss.

content.description: Climb the gully to a high first bolt. From here thought provoking, yet dirty slab will lead you to a large ledge. From the ledge level with the "Scarlet Begonias" anchors a variety of gear can be placed to protect the final face. Anchors are way back on the main cliff face. Could use some chains at the anchors.
content.location: Directly left of "The Nose." Look for the white face to the left of the route with the large tiered roof.

content.description: Climb the left facing dihedral with a quality layback section midway up to an easy finish.
content.protection: Rack to #4 Camalot. Belay from obvious cedar on the left at the top.

content.description: Great climbing up a smooth face leads to hard moves above a hueco. Smooth climbing above the crux to the anchors. Another classic!
content.location: 2nd climb to the left of Cruise Control

content.description: Climbs obvious right leaning crack that gets steeper right below the ledge. Everyone climbs this baby. There is even a cam stuck way down in the flake on the lower part of the climb waiting for someone to free it-be my guest!
content.location: In the middle of Crag Central below an old Cedar tree that is perched on the big ledge.

content.description: Sustained, technical climbing like much of this wall. Â A previous hold break made this route the hard 12 it is today.
content.location: Climbs through the black streak and curves left near the top.

content.description: This is the area that holds the classic Right to Flight/The Nose(5.9) trad climb. Also, this is a good place to rappel down by Cruise Control(5.7)
